title: חוק חופשה שנתית, תשי"א-1951
description: The Annual Leave Law 5711-1951 establishes the right of every employee to paid annual leave. It sets minimum leave entitlements based on length of service and regulates the timing and payment of leave.

provisions.title: Scope
provisions.content: Section 1. Every employee is entitled to annual leave with pay in accordance with this Law.

provisions.title: Leave Entitlement
provisions.content: Section 3. The minimum annual leave entitlement is: (a) 14 working days for the first 4 years of employment; (b) 16 days in the 5th year; (c) 18 days in the 6th year; (d) 21 days in the 7th year and beyond.

provisions.title: Timing of Leave
provisions.content: Section 5. The employer shall determine the timing of the annual leave after consulting with the employee. At least 7 consecutive days of leave shall be granted.

provisions.title: Leave Payment
provisions.content: Section 10. During annual leave, the employee shall be paid leave pay equivalent to the regular wages the employee would have received had the employee worked during that period.
